title: Why are people in general in such a rush to prove that 2020 is going to be a great decade and year? - Quora

response.answer_text: I think everyone is going thru some shit in their life - somehow or another. But nobody likes having a shitty life, and everyone wants to believe that things will get better, because, well otherwise, why not commit suicide right now? I’m not saying everyone is depressed, but I think that if we all found out that life only gets worse from here on, that would make us depressed and suicidal. But we don’t want that, so we tell ourselves that this year will be THE year. This year will be the new beginning; new chapter - of only good things. We can’t handle not thinking that. Whether we’re right or wrong, whether this year turns out to actually be a good year or not, next year we’ll do the same thing. Well, if this year actually turns out to be the turning point in our lives, then we won’t have to say the same thing next year - that 2021 will be the best year, because 2020 will have already made our lives seem worthwhile. But if 2020 sucks, then there’s always next year… “Today is yesterday’s tomorrow.”
